text: Would be great to be able to create system pages(errorpage, preference-center...) via CLI.

I wish `&&` in HubL worked like it does in JS and like `||` does in HubL and JS, with short-circuit evaluation. So if you did `{{ some_variable && some_other_variable }}` , it would be `some_other_variable` if `some_variable` is truthy. Instead it just returns `true`. So instead we have to set up an extra if statement or use ternary, both make the code look much messier to me.
EDIT: I just tested this in Jinja and Jinja2 and both behave as it does in JS, the way I want, where `{{ some_variable and some_other_variable }}` returns `some_other_variable` when `some_variable` is truthy, which means HubSpot must have changed the implementation? :disappointed: Or maybe this is a bug? The more I think about it, the more likely it seems like this is a bug.
<@U7SL518D6> Please let me know if this is a bug or intended, and if intended whatâ€™s the thinking/reasoning behind leaving short-circuit evaluation for `or` but removing it from `and`?

It would be great if we could create menus in HubSpot navigation and then have the option of selecting one of those menus as a child in another menu.  Thus being able to modularize the navigation menu for use in multiple places/layouts (main menu, side menu, etc) but only having to update them in one place
